content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
No new structures have been successfully placed on the map. Although the agent attempted to supply a Lab at (0.5, 2.5) and reattempted Lab crafting, all placement and production attempts failed. Other operations (such as retrieving furnaces at (5.0, 5.0) and at (–27.0, –60.0) for smelting tasks) referenced pre‐existing processing facilities and were used solely for resource conversion rather than being created by the agent.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API Call Errors with get_entities  
  – Avoid passing unsupported keywords (e.g. “radius”) and ensure that the number and type of positional arguments match the function’s signature.

• Lab Placement Failures  
  – Before attempting to place a Lab at (0.5, 2.5), verify that a Lab unit exists in the inventory to avoid placement errors.

• Iteration on a NoneType  
  – When filtering or iterating over entities returned from get_entities(), ensure that the fallback value is an empty iterable rather than None.

• Lab Crafting Resource Shortages  
  – Multiple lab crafting attempts failed due to missing sub-ingredients (such as iron-gear-wheel, electronic-circuit, and copper-cable). Confirm that all prerequisite resources and intermediary items are available and craftable before initiating a lab build.

• Overall Resource Chain Validation  
  – Repeated unavailability of a Lab indicates that the resource production chain (including smelting and crafting of required components) must be thoroughly verified and balanced before reattempting Lab creation.
